Yes, here are a few examples of effective and innovative approaches to online engagement that businesses have taken recently:

1. Peloton - Peloton is a fitness company that has created a community around their brand by offering live and on-demand workout classes. Their instructors provide a personal touch by calling out riders by name during the workouts and encouraging them. Additionally, Peloton created a leaderboard system that allows riders to compete against each other, providing a sense of motivation and engagement.

2. Glossier - Glossier is a beauty brand that has leveraged user-generated content (UGC) to engage with their audience. Glossier encourages their customers to share photos and reviews of their products on social media, providing a sense of community around their brand. They also take customer feedback into consideration when developing new products, creating a sense of collaboration with their audience.

3. Slack - Slack is a communication platform that has created a sense of community by creating Slack communities for users to join based on their interests or industries. These communities offer users the opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals and share information and resources.

4. Chipotle - Chipotle created a game called "Cado Crusher" that allows users to play a matching game while also learning about the ingredients and sourcing of their avocados. The game helps educate users on the brand's values and sustainability efforts while also providing a fun and engaging experience.

5. Lizzo x Dove - Dove collaborated with singer Lizzo to create a campaign that encourages body positivity and self-love. The campaign includes a website where users can take a quiz to discover their "body language" and learn tips on how to love and care for their bodies. The campaign also includes social media posts with the hashtag #LoveYourHair, encouraging users to share their own stories and experiences.
